title: Google Messages Might Integrate a WhatsApp Feature Soon
description: There's no word yet on when the feature will be officially introduced. The post Google Messages Might Integrate a WhatsApp Feature Soon appeared first on Phandroid.
author: Mike Viray
excerpt: There's no word yet on when the feature will be officially introduced.
text: It’s great to see Google finally giving its official Messages app the proper care and attention it deserves, after so many years of shuffling between various messaging apps and services. In addition to new updates for RCS, it looks like the Mountain View company could be working on a way to integrate WhatsApp calls into Google Messages. Image from Android Authority As reported in Android Authority’s APK teardown, version v20250131 of Google Messages shows an option to initiate a WhatsApp call – at the moment, tapping on a video call option within a message thread will initiate a Google Meet call setup page. At the moment however, this only worked for individual calls with no such options for group chats, which still shows the Google Meet option. READ: WhatsApp Might Add a Rather Interesting Feature for One-on-One Conversations Given that no official teaser was given by either Google or WhatsApp at this point, it’s unknown if and when Google will formally add this feature to the Messages app. Should it push through however, this might serve as a better option for most users given that not everyone uses Google Meet for casual video calls, and most users will have a WhatsApp account anyway. A writer and content creator with a love for tech and music, Mike is also an avid gamer as well. He and his wife are big fans of Mario Kart. html:
It’s great to see Google finally giving its official Messages app the proper care and attention it deserves, after so many years of shuffling between various messaging apps and services. In addition to new updates for RCS, it looks like the Mountain View company could be working on a way to integrate WhatsApp calls into Google Messages.

Image from Android Authority

As reported in Android Authority’s APK teardown, version v20250131 of Google Messages shows an option to initiate a WhatsApp call – at the moment, tapping on a video call option within a message thread will initiate a Google Meet call setup page. At the moment however, this only worked for individual calls with no such options for group chats, which still shows the Google Meet option.

READ: WhatsApp Might Add a Rather Interesting Feature for One-on-One Conversations

Given that no official teaser was given by either Google or WhatsApp at this point, it’s unknown if and when Google will formally add this feature to the Messages app. Should it push through however, this might serve as a better option for most users given that not everyone uses Google Meet for casual video calls, and most users will have a WhatsApp account anyway.

A writer and content creator with a love for tech and music, Mike is also an avid gamer as well. He and his wife are big fans of Mario Kart.
